comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: This machine was patented by Henry C. Hilke of Seattle, Washington, in 1913. He called it an "Elevator." It was powered by either a 5 h.p. gas engine or an electric motor. The note says "...the arms are removed from the stacker," but the machine appears to be complete. See U.S. Patent no. 1,053,391. Here's another photo: industrialphotos.industrialartifactsreview.com/photos_06_...
